intro: Carenidium paranaense, commonly known as the Parana sedge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Carenidium paranaense is often found in riparian zones and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
